title: Epstein Files Transparency Battle: Bipartisan Coalition vs White House Opposition
description: Research the extraordinary September 2025 political battle over releasing Jeffrey Epstein's government files, including the discharge petition needing only 2 more signatures, White House threats calling support a 'hostile act', Republican defections (Massie, Greene, Mace, Boebert), survivor testimony on Capitol Hill, FBI withholding 300GB of data, and Virginia Giuffre's April 2025 death. Document the Epstein Files Transparency Act (H.R.4405/S.2557), institutional resistance patterns, and upcoming Acosta testimony.

key_sources.title: Epstein Files Battle Intensifies This Week
key_sources.description: Comprehensive report on September 2025 transparency battle

key_sources.title: H.R.4405 - Epstein Files Transparency Act
key_sources.description: House bill requiring release of all Epstein files within 30 days

key_sources.title: Survivor Capitol Hill Testimony
key_sources.description: Nine survivors speak publicly for first time on September 3, 2025

expected_outcomes: Documents White House characterization of transparency support as hostile act
Reveals FBI withholding 99% of 300GB Epstein data archive
Shows Republican fracture with Massie, Greene, Mace, Boebert defying Trump
Exposes systematic institutional resistance to Epstein transparency

connections.description: Uses crisis acceleration to prevent transparency
